DOC.brief_title: Motivational Interviewing Support Oral AntiCoagulation Adherence Patients With Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation ( MISOAC-AF )
DOC.detailed_description: Study Purpose : To investigate impact motivational interviewing adherence patient AF oral anticoagulation ( OAC ) regimens Trial Type : Randomised clinical study Clinical Design : Prospective , single center , randomize control study Primary Objective : The primary outcome overall adherence OAC regimen year hospitalization reason , report continuous binary outcome Secondary Objective : The secondary clinical outcome combine endpoint death , acute myocardial infarction , hemorrhagic/ischemic stroke major bleed 1 year Sample Size : 1000 subject Population : Subjects Non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation ( NVAF ) OAC therapy prescribe OAC therapy hospitalize reason . Intervention 1 . Motivational Interview - Baseline : At hospital discharge , patient assign intervention group contact person study physician ( MD ) give leaflet educate risk stroke importance adherence OAC medication . 2 . Motivational Interview - Follow-up : Patients assign intervention group contact via telephone pre-specified interview 1 week , 2 month , 6 month 1 year discharge . The three element medication adherence ( initiation , implementation , discontinuation ) evaluate . Based patient 's dose history , delegate study personnel ass whether intervention require provide specific support tailor needs patient Control Patients assign control group contact via telephone pre-specified interview 1 year discharge Clinical Duration : The total study duration expect 3 year
